definition: telephone directory
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
a book/a register/account-book

sentences.english: Sure enough, I found her name in the phone book.
sentences.chinese: 果真，我在電話簿上找到了她的名字。

sentences.english: I can find the zip code in the phone book.
sentences.chinese: 我可以在電話簿上找到郵遞區號。

sentences.english: Chinese herbal pharmacies, and traditional massage therapists in the Vancouver telephone book.
sentences.chinese: 中藥店，和傳統的按摩師在溫哥華的電話簿裏。

sentences.english: Improved Bluetooth phone book transfer of contacts to in-vehicle Bluetooth solutions.
sentences.chinese: 改善聯繫人藍牙電話簿轉移至車載藍牙解決方案。

sentences.english: They looked at the telephone book.
The suspect was thumbing through the telephone directory when one policeman detained him.
sentences.chinese: 這個嫌疑犯正在翻弄電話簿的時候，被警察拘捕了。

sentences.english: Lee's telephone number in the directory.
sentences.chinese: 艾倫建議我們用電話簿查李的電話號碼。

sentences.english: I call you?Are you in the phone book?
sentences.chinese: 在電話簿中能查到你的號碼嗎？

sentences.english: Ellen suggested that we look up Lee's telephone number in the directory.
sentences.chinese: 艾倫建議我們用電話簿查李的電話號碼。

sentences.english: Then I searched a telephone book for the name on the umbrella and found it. I called and a lady answered.
sentences.chinese: 隨後我在電話簿裏查找傘上的名字，確有其人。

sentences.english: I'll look up his number in the phone-book.
sentences.chinese: 我會在電話簿中查他的電話號碼。

sentences.english: For example, you look up a number in the telephone book.
sentences.chinese: 比如你在電話簿上查某個電話號碼。

sentences.english: It’s like the phonebook of yesteryear – you need to be on it.
sentences.chinese: 網絡就像多年前的電話簿，你必須列名其上。

sentences.english: Then I searched a telephone book for the name on the umbrella and found it.
sentences.chinese: 隨後我在電話簿裏查找傘上的名字，確有其人。

definition: a memo book (recording events)
masthead (of a newspaper etc)/nameplate
protective coloration/camouflage
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
to whisper to one another's ear
see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
improvisation
reckless/extremely daring
extracurricular reading material
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
masquerade
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to return something to its rightful owner
to make a concession/to be accommodating
